Key Arguments: The bill is contrary to the principles of a free enterprise and democratic society.
Australia has historically prospered through free thinking, open-mindedness, and creativity.
The bill could lead to a totalitarian state where government decree overrides the will of the people.
The bill is seen as oppressive, similar to conditions immigrants sought to escape.
The bill's advocates are accused of committing treason.
Notable Quotes: This bill will ensure Australia becomes a totalitarian state and the will of its people becomes submerged by government decree.
Those advocating this Bill are actually committing treason.
